==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|新|羅}}

===Etymology 1===
The final ''-raki'' may be cognate with the second syllable of {{m|ja|奈良|tr=Nara}} (the name of a city and prefecture located in the {{w|Kansai region}} of Japan) and with the name of the ''Garak''/''Gara''/''{{w|Gaya confederacy}}'' (a loose confederation of city-states located at the southern tip of the Korean Peninsula in ancient times). Compare also the modern Korean {{m|ko|나라||country, kingdom}}, from Middle Korean {{m|okm|나랗||tr=narah}}, and modern Korean {{m|ko|땅||land, ground, territory}}, from Middle Korean {{m|okm||ㅅ닿|tr=sdah}}, and modern Korean {{m|ko|흙||earth, soil}}, from Middle Korean {{m|okm|ㅎ．ㄺ||tr=hɔlg}}.

====Pronunciation====
{{ja-pron|しらき}}

====Proper noun====
{{ja-pos|proper noun|しらき}}

# an ancient kingdom existing on the Korean Peninsula between 57 BC and 935 AD; {{w|Silla}}
